52575.title: University Avenue, looking north from Queen's Park to Bloor Street
52575.text:
1930
Description: 1 photoprint : b&w; ; 20 x 25 cm. — 1 photonegative : b&w; ; 10 x 12 cm
Citation: Fonds 1244, Item 1005
Condition: OPEN - No restrictions on these non-government records.
Copyright: Copyright is in the public domain and permission for use is not required...more
Scope: Item consists of one photograph. A newspaper article (undated) attached to the print reads: "Fate of Noble Old Elms at Stake. The proposal of Works Commissioner R.C. Harris to widen Avenue Rd. between Queen's Park Cres. and Bloor St. to a width of 54 feet, would destroy the two rows of elm trees shown ABOVE. In all there are over 50 large trees which grace the northern approach to Queen's Park. The proposal to widen the thoroughfare was approved last week by the works committee, but their decision was rescinded when objection was raised by Parks Commissioner Charles Chambers. He urged the widening to a width of 36 feet, thus saving the trees. The present roadway is 28 feet wide. The approach to the home of Sir Joseph Flavelle woudl be affected by the widening."

Ryan:
Objects: person, sports ball
Scene: Outdoor
  Attributes: trees (0.87), vegetation (0.25), driving (0.12), biking (0.11), pavement (0.05), no horizon (0.04), sunny (-0.30), grass (-0.67), snow (-0.69)
  Categories: promenade (0.36), residential_neighborhood (0.15), street (0.11), forest_road (0.07), park (0.03)
